column5: I‚Äôve heard it‚Äôs better to wash, as dry shampoo just cakes the sebum on your scalp, causing dandruff and potentially breakage at the root from the drying ingredients. I usually wash my hair daily with no problems!
They have made mine go away pretty much fully. I maybe hear something once a month.

I‚Äôm getting married next year and have been with my fianc√© for 8 years. He‚Äôs been with me through my diagnosis and all, he‚Äôs my rock. I guess we make it work like any other relationship, just with more understanding and sensitivity towards my schizophrenia.
I‚Äôm mixture of hedgehog and yellow bird lol
No problem! And yes I am diagnosed with schizophrenia. If you think you may have symptoms, I encourage you to talk to a doctor or psychiatrist, they are the only ones that can diagnose schizophrenia.
I have this happen to me, you‚Äôre not alone on this.
Really cool idea!
A diagnosis of schizophrenia typically requires you to have at least 2 of 3 things: hallucinations, delusions, and disorganized speech. If you still are worried, talk to a psychiatrist.

No problem! If you are worried I would suggest seeing a psychiatrist if possible, just to calm those worries. If it makes you feel any better, I‚Äôve meet very few schizophrenics who do not have hallucinations or delusions. Hope all is going well with you!

I don‚Äôt mind at all! I knew something was wrong, as I had visual and auditory hallucinations and some delusional thinking. It started out as more innocent hallucinations like someone calling my name, but got progressively more demanding and aggressive. The visuals got scarier and more surreal. That‚Äôs when I knew I probably did have schizophrenia, as it runs in my family. I went to a psychiatrist who then officially diagnosed me and put me on medications which have helped immensely!
I have schizophrenia and am aware I have schizophrenia. But I agree, OP should seek a psychiatrist for proper treatment and diagnosis.
Happy birthday! Same thing happened to me, so you‚Äôre not alone. I hope you have a good day!
Same with me. My parents are very supportive, but I‚Äôm noticing a few of my close ‚Äúfriends‚Äù becoming much more distant after disclosing my diagnosis...
I have a few! But mine never stay big like her‚Äôs do
It triggered psychosis for me. Now that I‚Äôm medicated, it just makes me really sick so I stay away from it now.
I don‚Äôt live alone so I typically can tell if no one else is reacting to it, then it‚Äôs not real. But my hallucinations are reoccurring so I know when they happen and know they aren‚Äôt real.
It‚Äôs a great and unique scent!

Congrats!!
No problem!

Love the blue color theme!

First, would talk to a psychiatrist before you get too scared, most psychologists or therapists aren‚Äôt as qualified as a psychiatrist to diagnose a disorder like schizophrenia. 

Second, I don‚Äôt know if it makes you feel any better but I am a diagnosed with schizophrenia and it‚Äôs not the end of the world. I guess in ways it‚Äôs like any diagnosis, life continues on and you learn to cope. I have schizophrenia, but I‚Äôm also in grad school, I am getting married, every job I‚Äôve held has been stable. It doesn‚Äôt mean someone‚Äôs crazy, it‚Äôs just a chemical imbalance in someone‚Äôs brain. 

Talk to a psychiatrist if you are worried, they can help you with the anxiety and help get you answers, I know what it‚Äôs like to not have answers. I wish you well!

I like your idea of living a successful life with schizophrenia! I live what I‚Äôd deem a successful life, even though I have schizophrenia. I think it‚Äôd be great to dispute the stereotype that we basically all have to live our lives hospitalized; we can have very successful careers, relationships, etc.
I have a phone appointment with my psych on Monday!
Thanks! I‚Äôm trying to stay positive it will, as all my other items I ordered the same day have already arrived to me.

I ordered a computer and monitor for school (as I now have to finish my senior year of college online) Wednesday the 18th. My amazon says they will be delivered Wednesday the 25th, but it doesn‚Äôt say they have shipped yet. Is that possible to receive it by the 25th? I start online school the 30th and need that computer...
No problem!

I‚Äôve been very lucky and have parents and grandparents that have been very supportive, however schizophrenia runs in my family, so it wasn‚Äôt a huge shock when after my first psychotic break that I was also schizophrenic.

I agree. Every psych I‚Äôve ever talked to says stay far far away from drugs and alcohol if you‚Äôre schizophrenic, and my worst psychosis was during a time of heavy partying so I agree. Nothing good to be gained from drugs if you deal with psychosis.

I haven‚Äôt gained weight while on Abilify and it has helped my hallucinations a lot. I do feel tired all the time though. To combat the jitters I take it at night, I do feel like my ability to sit still has lessened, but not to the point of it interfering with my daily life.
I never had time for masks. Now I‚Äôm masking like every day because I‚Äôm so bored LOL at least my skin is looking the best it‚Äôs been in a while!

‚ÄúThey‚Äôre a bit extreme‚Äù is what got me. Yes schizophrenia is a more ‚Äúsevere‚Äù disorder than some other mental illnesses but Jesus. It‚Äôs like I‚Äôm not some extreme freak, I just happen to have a chemical imbalance in my brain. I‚Äôm sorry you had to deal with that. It‚Äôs infuriating and I‚Äôm hurt right alongside you, you‚Äôre not alone.

Its been positive for me! I had to leave college with one day‚Äôs notice to go back home. Packed up in an hour and fit everything into my small car and hit the road, so much less stress than the others I knew.
I find the mornings or when it is quiet is when I get my auditory hallucinations the most.
This doesn‚Äôt sound like schizophrenia, more like anxiety. If you are worried see your doctor. Hope you feel better!

It‚Äôs a process because most psychiatrists will diagnose it by eliminating other possibilities like bipolar, depression, other psychosis, etc. it took me about 9 months and many kinds of medications for other stuff before the doctor was confident in diagnosing me schizophrenic.
Same!
I like Abilify, it seems the longer I‚Äôm on it the less I notice I‚Äôm even on a meditation.

I use vanicream bar soap for face and body, my dermatologist recommended this and it works great. You can also use your shampoo as body wash.

My night and say moisturizer is the same, then I have sunscreen which is nonnegotiable. 

I suggest watching Dr. Dray videos as she is a dermatologist that really emphasizes minimalist skincare!

I have a friend who is very into art, so as a gift I made a gift box of my supplies I didn‚Äôt need or use anymore and he loved it! It made me feel good knowing it went to someone who would genuinely use it.

How did you fade your dark circles? I swear I‚Äôll take any improvement to mine at this point lol

Are you using the tretinoin on your under eye area? Put a little moisturizer or Vaseline on your under eye and around your mouth before applying your tretinoin, that way it doesn‚Äôt get near your eye. I had the same problem around my mouth, but it went away in time

Don‚Äôt put tret on wet skin, and dampening your face when you just put tret on before it will just wash it off. You can put your moisturizer on damp skin, wait 20 minutes and then put tret on if you want to buffer the irritation a bit.
I take spiro and I think I might have heard that before but my doctor never said anything about it. I have never had any adverse effects while on spiro and I eat high potassium foods.
My skin didn‚Äôt clear until 6 months in, but I also had pretty bad acne so it could have been just me.

I wanted to try using it on my neck but got scared because my derm told me to not put on my neck or around my eyes. I wonder if a retinol could be used on those areas for anti-aging but less irritating? Glad to hear you recovered!

This is what I was wondering.

It‚Äôs been there as long as I can tell, though as a kid I had a really chubby face so it‚Äôs hard to tell then, but I‚Äôve had it since being an early teen for sure, and it seems to have gotten a bit worse as I‚Äôve gotten older. Not anything deformed looking, but enough that I‚Äôve had people point it out. I‚Äôll probably never know the cause, but I was just curious if Lyme could cause something like this so quickly to a child.
I don‚Äôt remember treatment as I was so young and sensation is as normal as it‚Äôs always been!

I do not know if I ever had facial paralysis, but I wonder it caused some muscle or nerve damage. I can move my face fine, it‚Äôs just always one side is more droopy, even when I smile! Odd! And I do not have any symptoms that I know of currently, I am very lucky in that regard! Glad to hear you are also doing well!! üòÉ

I use unscented mineral oil as per my derm‚Äôs recommendation. I was super skeptical at first as I am VERY acne prone and it has never broken me out. Turns out mineral oil is non-comedogenic! Super cheap, easy to wash off with a gentle cleanser, and very effective.
Vanicream cleanser is just like the cerave hydrating cleanser!

I‚Äôve used both products. If you‚Äôre asking about the moisturizers, I like them both pretty much the same. The cerave has ceramides which is a plus, but can sometimes feel too thick or filmy on my skin. The vanicream, although just as thick, doesn‚Äôt feel as thick. Plus I like how it comes in a pump bottle. If you don‚Äôt like the thicker ones, each brand has a lite lotion, which I love equally among them, maybe vanicream a tad bit more, but not enough to influence my purchase if cerave is the only thing at the store. I also really like the Cetaphil in the tub as it has a nut oil that really makes it feel smooth on the skin.

No one knows for sure whether she or anyone has an eating disorder just by looking at their physical appearance. There are many medical conditions that can cause an appearance as such. It‚Äôs not fair to anyone to assume their health based on their looks.

I understand a lot what you are going through.

I wish I could offer advice, but it seems that our sisters will just have to get help themselves in order to change.

1. Vanicream or Cerave is gonna probably be the best bet for a moisturizer. It helped my skin so much. I even bought a travel one to keep in my purse to reapply during the day lol

2. For better hydration I apply my moisturizer on wet skin, then when it‚Äôs dry I apply my Tretinoin. Works really well. 

3. If you‚Äôre going to use actives, do it in the morning, you don‚Äôt want to compromise the tretinoin, unless your dermatologist says it‚Äôs ok. Too many actives can cause irritation though, so holding off on them until your skin becomes accustom to the retinoid will lead to less dryness.
Go for it! I saw best results at .1%.
I have heard this before. It‚Äôs usually always best to listen to your derm

Acne is considered a chronic skin condition. Just because your skin clears from a product doesn‚Äôt mean your acne is cured. I‚Äôve been using tretinoin and benzoyl peroxide for 8 years and if I stop, the acne comes back. I would continue to use it regularly until your doctor says otherwise.
Oh gosh this is so pretty! I might have to steal this look for the holidays

I‚Äôve had this happen to me as well, multiple times. It‚Äôs a horrible feeling. Stay strong! It will get better, especially with the medications and advancements in skin care today, I believe there is a lot of hope for clear skin out there for everyone.
Oh I didn‚Äôt know that. Still they look pretty good! I would absolutely love for her to make her own skincare though

I would love to have different healthy smoothies every day, but buying all those ingredients, plus a nice blender, is out of budget at the moment

I‚Äôm trying to be more sustainable in my minimalist journey and I‚Äôve really loved thrifting on second hand sites like ThreadUp, Depop, and Poshmark because they have nice, good quality brands, that you can easily search up and find. If you want quality, go for natural fabrics; cotton, linen, silk, wool. These sites have them for pretty inexpensive! I love Everlane, J Crew, Uniqlo, Anthropology. I‚Äôve gotten linen, silk and wool on the sites for less than 20$, all in great condition.

This is what I use! I use them as storage during the time I need them, and anything else that doesn‚Äôt fit in them, I just fit in a trash bag (like my clothes) when it‚Äôs time to move. Super easy and durable so they can be used much longer than cardboard boxes.

I found that I need way less than I actually thought. 

I have a very small wardrobe (you won‚Äôt have much space to fit tons of clothes anyway, trust me my roommates tried)

I own 1 pair of bed sheets (I just wash them with my clothes and remake the bed the same day, I never even used my other sets)

2 towels, same as the bed sheets, I wash them with my clothes, I‚Äôll probably downsize to just 1. 

1 pillow, though I do get a lot of use from one of those back pillows for when I don‚Äôt want to use my desk provided

A plant I‚Äôve had for a while for decoration

My ‚Äújunk drawer‚Äù is a small tin that fits my small first aid and my single nail polish, my 2 pieces of jewelry, etc

I didn‚Äôt bring any rugs, they dirty so easily and sweeping is much easier.

Only a few pairs of shoes, you‚Äôll mainly be wearing tennis shoes anyway, but 1 nice pair for interviews and presentations is a good idea

I keep my sink clutter free, the stuff piles up easily especially if you have roommates. Also limit bath stuff, all my roommates brought exorbitant amounts of hair products and makeup and shampoos, and it was all thrown out at the end of the year. 

Spurge on a nice desk chair though, one you can see yourself using after college. If your dorm comes with a good one then use that, but most I‚Äôve seen come with stools. Getting something you can see yourself using outside of college means you won‚Äôt have to buy a second one when you graduate! It‚Äôs a splurge, but really worth it. 

If you do enough digging, you can find a PDF of most of your textbooks online for free, at least I did. And if not, I only bought the kindle versions. Books take up so much room. 

It took trial and error for me to learn what I really needed, but I love my dorm now that it has so much less clutter than my previous years dorms. I feel I can focus better on my tasks, and it just feels much more like me.
I‚Äôd be more willing to buy his stuff than an influencer‚Äôs, I trust a seasoned professional like him way more than a YouTuber lol.
